body_html: Same issue here, solved by downloading file from a different unofficial source. I think we should put in place an officially recognized mirror somewhere. Does anyone know if tensorflow checks a sort of signature for the dataset before using it? Or if a signature (e.g. md5) is available for the MNIST dataset so people can exchange it via unofficial circuits.

body: Same issue here, solved by downloading file from a different unofficial source. I think we should put in place an officially recognized mirror somewhere. Does anyone know if tensorflow checks a sort of signature for the dataset before using it? Or if a signature (e.g. md5) is available for the MNIST dataset so people can exchange it via unofficial circuits.
